div.p: Upper: observed geographic distribution of eastern North American (blue) mtDNA haplotypes at the ND2 locus and those found predominantly in the Florida peninsula (yellow; e.g., Figure 1) along a transect from Key Largo (FL) to Houston (TX) in B.Â lineatus. Lower: inferred probability of observing eastern haplotypes along the same transect based on a logistic fit to a cumulative normal distribution. 20%, 50%, and 80% points in the distribution are indicated by vertical bars
